policy.name: charging postgraduate research students fees
policy.description: the federal government should let universities charge postgraduate research students fees

policy.name: an emissions reduction fund
policy.description: the federal government should introduce an emissions reduction fund so it can buy domestic greenhouse gas emissions reductions and offsets by reverse auction. This is a key part of the Coalition Government's Direct Action policy.

policy.name: increasing the price of subsidised medicine
policy.description: the federal government should increase the amount that patients pay for medicine under the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS) and the Repatriation Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (known as the 'co-payment')

policy.name: increasing indexation of HECS-HELP debts
policy.description: Higher Education Loan Programme (HELP) debts - also known as HECS-HELP debts - should be indexed in line with the ten-year bond rate, capped at six per cent, instead of the generally lower rate of the Consumer Price Index (CPI)

policy.name: tighter means testing of family payments
policy.description: the federal government should target family payments to low and moderate income households, to the exclusion of higher income households.

policy.name: increasing beef import standards
policy.description: the federal government should increase the standards and assessment processes that protect the public and beef industry from diseases such as mad cow disease

policy.name: encouraging Australian-based industry
policy.description: the federal government should encourage Australian-based industry and secure the jobs these industries create by, for example, providing incentives for companies to stay in Australia

policy.name: deregulating undergraduate university fees
policy.description: the federal government should remove limits on the amount that universities can charge students for tuition in Commonwealth Supported Places (CSPs)

policy.name: decreasing availability of welfare payments
policy.description: the federal government should limit the availability of government social security payments

policy.name: government administered paid parental leave
policy.description: the federal government should administer the paid parental leave scheme rather than employers

policy.name: privatising government assets
policy.description: the federal government should privatise government owned assets

policy.name: live animal export
policy.description: the federal government should allow live animal export and place minimal restrictions on it

policy.name: funding the national school chaplaincy program
policy.description: The federal government should continue to fund the National School Chaplaincy Program (NSCP) to fund chaplains in Australian primary and secondary schools

policy.name: increasing funding for road infrastructure
policy.description: the federal government should provide more funding for road infrastructure

policy.name: uranium export
policy.description: the federal government should support the exportation of uranium from Australia

policy.name: recognising local government in the Constitution
policy.description: local government should be recognised in the Australian Constitution

policy.name: temporary protection visas
policy.description: the Federal government should introduce temporary protection visas

policy.name: the Intervention in the Northern Territory
policy.description: the Federal Government should respond to reports about high levels of child sexual abuse in some Indigenous communities in the Northern Territory by introducing the Northern Territory National Emergency Response or the very similar Stronger Futures Policy, also referred to as "the intervention"

policy.name: increasing or removing the debt limit
policy.description: the federal government should increase the limit on the total amount of Commonwealth stock and securities that may be on issue at any time (known as the 'debt limit') or remove the limit altogether

policy.name: unconventional gas mining
policy.description: the federal government should allow companies to mine coal seam (CSG), tight and shale gas

policy.name: decreasing ABC and SBS funding
policy.description: the federal government should decrease funding for the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) and the Special Broadcasting Service (SBS)

policy.name: offshore processing of asylum seekers
policy.description: asylum seekers who arrive in Australia without a visa, particularly those who arrive by boat, should have their asylum claims processed offshore in an Australian territory like Christmas Island

policy.name: regional processing of asylum seekers
policy.description: asylum seekers who arrive in Australia without a visa, particularly those who arrive by boat, should have their asylum claims processed regionally in a country such as the Republic of Nauru

policy.name: increasing surveillance powers
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation to increase the powers of intelligence and law enforcement agencies to intercept and retain communications related to persons of interest. These agencies include the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO), Australian Secret Intelligence Service (ASIS) and the Australian Federal Police (AFP).

policy.name: increasing access under Freedom of Information law
policy.description: the federal government should amend freedom of information (FOI) legislation to increase public access to government data and documents

policy.name: greater public scrutiny of the Trans-Pacific Partnership negotiations
policy.description: the Australian Government should publicly release more information about it’s position in the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) trade negotiations

policy.name: voluntary student union fees
policy.description: university students should be able to choose whether or not to pay student services and amenities fees (also called student union fees)

policy.name: protecting whales within Australian waters
policy.description: the Federal Government should protect whales within Australian waters by, for example, taking action against the Japanese Government over its whaling program in the Southern Ocean

policy.name: giving apprentices access to a $20,000 loan
policy.description: the federal government should introduce a loan program for apprentices, to a maximum of $20,000, like the program currently available for university students

policy.name: increasing restrictions on gambling
policy.description: the federal government should increase restrictions on the gambling industry in order to address the issue of problem gambling

policy.name: extending government benefits to same-sex couples
policy.description: the federal government should extend any financial and work-related entitlements and benefits that currently only apply to heterosexual couples to same-sex couples and their children

policy.name: increasing Aboriginal land rights
policy.description: the federal government should increase Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander land rights by, for example, increasing their legal recognition and protection

policy.name: decreasing the gender pay gap
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation that reduces the gap in income between women and men and ensures both sexes are paid equally well

policy.name: removing children from immigration detention
policy.description: the federal government should not put asylum seeker children into immigration detention and should release all children now in detention

policy.name: increasing accessibility of government data
policy.description: The federal government should make its data and documents more accessible for the general public and Parliament

policy.name: increasing scrutiny of asylum seeker management
policy.description: there should be more independent access to detention centres and more information provided about the management of asylum seekers under Australian government policy, including the interception of boats at sea

policy.name: decreasing the private health insurance rebate
policy.description: the federal government should decrease the private health insurance rebate that eligible taxpayers are entitled to

policy.name: increasing investment in renewable energy
policy.description: the federal government should increase investment in renewable energy technologies

policy.name: implementing refugee and protection conventions
policy.description: the federal government should implement the international conventions that relate to seeking refuge and protection from torture. These include the Convention relating to the Status of Refugees, the Protocol relating to the Status of Refugees and the non-refoulement provisions of the UN Convention Against Torture and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

policy.name: increasing protection of Aboriginal heritage sites
policy.description: the federal government should increase the protection of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultural heritage sites

policy.name: increasing consumer protections
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation that increases consumer protections by, for example, encouraging competition

policy.name: more scrutiny of intelligence services & police
policy.description: there should be more scrutiny or oversight of the actions and powers of Australian intelligence and law enforcement agencies, including the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO), the Australian Secret Intelligence Service (ASIS) and the Australian Federal Police (AFP)

policy.name: same-sex marriage equality
policy.description: the Federal Government should amend the Marriage Act 1961 so that same-sex couples can marry under Australian law

policy.name: increasing marine conservation
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation and regulations that protect and conserve Australia's marine ecosystems such as the Great Barrier Reef

policy.name: a carbon price
policy.description: the federal government should introduce a carbon pricing mechanism

policy.name: the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme
policy.description: the federal government should introduce the Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme, which is a cap-and-trade system of emissions trading introduced by the Rudd Labor Government

policy.name: increasing protection of Australia's fresh water
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation that increases the protection of Australia's fresh water resources, including its river and groundwater systems

policy.name: increasing funding for university education
policy.description: the federal government should increase funding for university education

policy.name: increasing fishing restrictions
policy.description: the federal government should increase fishing restrictions so that fish populations are sustainable

policy.name: a minerals resource rent tax
policy.description: the federal government should put a tax on profits earned from mining mineral resources such as coal and iron ore

policy.name: an NBN (using fibre to the premises)
policy.description: the federal government should introduce a National Broadband Network ('NBN') using the fibre to the premises ('FTTP') design

policy.name: restricting foreign ownership
policy.description: the federal government should restrict foreign ownership within Australia, particularly where foreign ownership would be against the national interest

policy.name: increasing trade unions' powers in the workplace
policy.description: the federal government should introduce legislation that increases the powers and influence of trade unions in workplace relations

policy.name: tobacco plain packaging
policy.description: the federal government should introduce plain packaging for tobacco products

policy.name: increasing the diversity of media ownership
policy.description: the federal government should use regulation to increase the diversity of publishers and broadcasters in Australia's media industry by, for example, setting a threshold for the maximum market share of any one company.

policy.name: carbon farming
policy.description: the federal government should introduce a carbon farming initiative that encourages the farming and timber industries to decrease carbon emissions or to increase carbon storage (known as carbon sequestration)

policy.name: increasing competition in bulk wheat export
policy.description: the federal government should deregulate Australia's wheat export market so that bulk wheat export is no longer done through a single exporter (which is known as a 'single desk' policy)

policy.name: stem cell research
policy.description: the federal government should allow certain types of stem cell research, including human embryo research

policy.name: increasing the age pension
policy.description: the federal government should increase the amount of the age pension

policy.name: increasing availability of abortion drugs
policy.description: the federal government should increase the availability of RU486 and other medications that can induce an abortion

policy.name: requiring a warrant to access citizens' telecommunications records
policy.description: staff of government agencies should need a warrant before being able to access the telecommunications records of citizens

policy.name: re-approving/ re-registering agvet chemicals
policy.description: the federal government should, in relation to agricultural and veterinary ('agvet') chemicals, implement a mandatory scheme for the re-approval of active constituents and re-registration of chemical products to ensure their ongoing safety

policy.name: building Australia’s new submarine fleet in South Australia
policy.description: the federal government should make sure that a planned fleet of 12 new submarines is built in South Australia (this new fleet was proposed in 2013 to replace the existing Collins Class submarine fleet)
